editorials.title: Two Sum Editorial
editorials.author: Admin
editorials.content: The optimal solution to the Two Sum problem involves using a hash map to store the indices of numbers as you iterate through the array. This approach provides an O(n) solution.

editorials.title: Reverse String Editorial
editorials.author: Admin
editorials.content: Reversing a string in-place involves using two pointers, one starting at the beginning and the other at the end of the array, and swapping their values until they meet in the middle.

editorials.title: Palindrome Number Editorial
editorials.author: Admin
editorials.content: To check if a number is a palindrome, compare the digits from the ends toward the center. Negative numbers are not palindromes due to the '-' sign.
